ccUploadGuidanceUploadProcessLineOne: The steps of the upload process are as follows:
ccUploadGuidanceUploadProcessLineTwo: - Upload the CSV file containing the product IDs and landings.
ccUploadGuidanceUploadProcessLineThree: - If there are multiple errors, you can clear the upload amend the file, and reupload.
ccUploadGuidanceUploadProcessLinefour: - The steps will take you back to the Add landings page where you can add any missing landings manually or correct any mistakes you find.
ccUploadGuidanceUploadProcessLinefive: You can repeat this process to upload multiple CSV files.
ccUploadGuidanceLimitationLineOne: The maximum number of rows that can be uploaded per catch certificate is 100.
ccUploadGuidanceLimitationLineTwo: You can only upload products that have been saved in your product favourites, accessible from the main navigation.
ccUploadGuidanceLimitationLineThree: If your export contains multiple products from the same landing, the landing will need to be repeated for each product.
ccUploadGuidanceProductIdLineOne: Product IDs are created when a
ccUploadGuidanceProductIdLineTwo: They are unique to each user and are used to speed up the process of uploading products.
ccUploadGuidanceProductIdLineThree: Product IDs are only used internally by the FES service and have no relevance to the final catch certificate.
ccUploadGuidanceCsvFileTypeLineOne: The upload file must be a CSV file (CSV stands for Comma Separated Values).
ccUploadGuidanceCsvFileTypeLineTwo: CSV files can be generated by exporting from spreadsheets or other software with an export feature.
ccUploadGuidanceCsvDataStructureLineOne: Do not include a header row.
ccUploadGuidanceCsvDataStructureLineTwo: Each row must have the following structure:
ccUploadGuidanceCsvDataStructureLineThre: Product ID, Start date, Date landed, Catch area, High Seas area, EEZ, RFMO, Vessel PLN, Gear type, Export weight
ccUploadGuidanceCsvDataStructureLineFive: Only use commas to separate fields (known as 'delimiters').
ccUploadGuidanceCsvDataStructureLineSix: You are advised to group the rows together in a way that makes it easy for you to check the upload. For example, you could group landings by product or by vessel.
ccUploadGuidanceCsvValidationlineOne: Uploaded products and landings will be subjected to the same validation as those entered manually.
ccUploadGuidanceCsvValidationlineTwo: If some rows fail to upload and you want to add them later manually, you should make a note of them before continuing.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentProductIdL: The product ID must refer to a product saved in your product favourites.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentStartDateL: Start dates must be real dates in the format 'dd/mm/yyyy'.
Dates cannot be more than 7 days in the future.
Start dates must not be after the landed dates.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentCatchAreaL: The catch area must be a FAO major fishing area.
A list of the major fishing areas is available from:
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentHighSeasLi: To indicate if a catch was made in high seas.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentEEZLineOne: EEZ must be entered as a 2 or 3 character country ISO codes.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentEEZLineTwo: If providing multiple EEZ, these must be separated by a semi-colon.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentDateLanded: Landing dates must be real dates in the format 'dd/mm/yyyy'.
Dates cannot be more than 7 days in the future.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentVesselPlnL: The PLN must be a valid Vessel PLN.
Vessels must be licensed on the date the catch was landed.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentGearTypeLi: The gear type must be entered as a 2 or 3 character code.
The gear type must be a valid gear type code.
ccUploadGuidanceDataRequirmentExportweig: The export weight must be in kilograms (kg).
Weights must be greater than zero with up to two decimal places.
